title: Planning Department Records - Non-Projects
description: A. SUMMARY Records from the Planning Department's Accela database, excluding project (PRJ) records. This dataset includes non-project records, but it also include child records related to parent PRJ records. Child records associated with a parent PRJ record often represent the supplemental applications required by the Planning Department to review a development project. The dataset of PRJ records can be found at https://data.sfgov.org/Economy-and-Community/Planning-Department-Projects/qvu5-m3a2/about_data. B. HOW THE DATASET IS CREATED Records exported from the Planning Department's Accela permitting system. C. UPDATE PROCESS Updated nightly D. HOW TO USE THIS DATASET For further information on permits: https://sfplanning.org/permits Record types are listed here: https://sfplanning.org/resource/project-suffixes-and-descriptions-case-numbers

columns.name: LOT
columns.description: Assessor's lot number, aka parcel. If multiple parcels are associated with a record, the primary parcel is listed.

columns.name: PARENT_ID
columns.description: Record number of the related parent record. For most development projects, the PRJ record serves as the parent record.

columns.name: CHILD_ID
columns.description: Record number of related child records

columns.name: BUILDING_PERMITS
columns.description: Building permit applications related to the project (BPA's on file with Department of Building Inspection).

columns.name: ASSIGNED_TO_PLANNER
columns.description: Name of planner assigned to the record

whom_it_may_interest: City planners, developers, policy makers, and individuals interested in obtaining permits or following city planning records.

queries.Monthly: SELECT record_type, record_status, date_trunc_ym(open_date) AS month, COUNT(*) AS count WHERE open_date >= '2022-09-01' GROUP BY record_type, record_status, month ORDER BY month, record_type, record_status
queries.Yearly: SELECT record_type, record_status, date_trunc_y(open_date) AS year, COUNT(*) AS count WHERE open_date >= '2022-09-01' GROUP BY record_type, record_status, year ORDER BY year, record_type, record_status
